summary: This bill, the "Gerald E. Connolly Esophageal Cancer Awareness Act of 2025," directs the Comptroller General to report on esophageal cancer within the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program. The report will analyze healthcare spending related to esophageal cancer and assess the frequency of screening for high-risk individuals covered by the program. The bill highlights the severity and increasing incidence of esophageal cancer, emphasizing the need for awareness, early detection, and improved outcomes.
